content: „desired in this case means until you reach the start of your toes si made a sock in size 39 and made 14 rounds if you count the double_crochet on top last round in the last round stop before you begin with the ldc pic 1 count your st for the sole in my case 20 we want to smoothen the edge just as we did with the edge of the leg so around the 10th stitch of the sole we want to be on the same level as the previous row make 5 half_double_crochet then 5 single_crochet pic 2 then 1 slip_stitch fasten_off 14 this is what your sock should look like now 15 toes the toe section is worked in ldc place markers on the sides of the sock in your last double_crochet of the top on each side we will do decreases 2 ldc decrease before and after the marked st not in the marked st itself join your colour a in the last st of colour b pic 1 chain 1 1 single_crochet in the same st 1 half_double_crochet work ldc until 2 st before the 1st marker pic 2 then do a decr by working 2 ldc together pic 3 you already practised that on the heel section 1 2 3 work 1 ldc in the st with the marker and place the marker into that new st again than again 2 ldc decrease ldc until you reach the next marker and so on you are done when you lay your sock flat in front of you and can count 4 rounds on top of the sock fasten_off and leave a tail for sewing it together turn your sock to the left side and close the whole by sewing it together use the tail you left 16 ribbing the ribbing is made with fphdc and bphdc i added a row of crab stittches just because they are so pretty but feel free to skip that step if you have trouble with that stitch you can start directly with the ribbing instead crab stitch join your colour b where you fasten- ded off coulour a work a round in crab stitch if you haven●t tried that stitch yet there are tons of youtu- be-tutorials basically the crab st is single_crochet worked to the right not left 17 ribbing after the crab stitches do a round of bpsc insert your hook into the last round of colour a not b pic 1 this will turn the crab stitches to the front and let them pop up really nicely if you have skipped the crab stitches just work a round of bpsc now we do the actual ribbing made of bphdc and fphdc chain 2 then work a fph- double_crochet around the post of the bpsc of the previous round pic 2 18 do 5 rounds of fphdc/bphdc fasten_off weave in all the loose ends congratulations you have finished your first sock the second sock is done the
